item.description:
Volunteers needed to help stop the spread of spotted knapweed 

  The state's Division of Fisheries and Wildlife recently approved a Spotted Knapweed Management Plan put together by our own member Irena Kadis allowing us to help control this aggressive invasive plant. (The picture at left from Irena's website Salicicola.com shows, "Little bluestem and golden asters step aside under the pressure of the newcomer.")  Repeated cutting of the flower stalks during the plant's flowering season will stop the spread, and over time, kill the plants.  The plants are now in flower and will continue to bloom through October. 

V olunteers will travel as a group to various locations in the forest to cut the flower stalks and place them in garbage bags. We will need to hold  subsequent work parties to remove the flower stalks until the end of the flowering season.  Please help stop spotted knapweed in MSSF. 
What to bring: clippers, choppers, or favorite plant cutting tool, gloves, hat, sunscreen, insect repellent and water. We'll plan to work for about two hours.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: First Sunday Weed Eradication Work Party
